page.title: 08Pontycymer's remaining mine
page.content: The Garw colliery is the only mine still open in Pontycymer, and the largest employer. Even though the Ffaldau colliery has closed, it is merged with the Garw colliery resulting in more than eleven miles of underground roadway . There are just under 4 miles of high-speed conveyer belts which transfer coal to the shafts and the washery. The length of a coal face is about 200 metres , each face holding some Â£0.5 million of equiptment. Coal producton averages 240000 tonnes per year. The coal is of excellent quality especialy useful as house coal while the steel industry uses the more inferior. Workable coal reserves are estimated at 7.5 million tonnes, as elswhere in South Wales geological problems reduce output per man and increase the production cost.
